text: Iguaçu Falls are a series of extremely large waterfalls that lie on the border of Argentina 80% and Brazil 20%. It is fed by the Iguaçu River, which flows into the Paraná River. 275 individual waterfalls side by side, some as tall as , make up the falls, though most are around . The falls divide the river into the upper and lower Iguaçu. It is one of the largest and most famous waterfalls in the world, receiving thousands of visitors each year. Category:Waterfalls Category:Bodies of water of South America Category:Misiones Province Category:Geography of Brazil
title: Iguaçu Falls
